column2: edgreason, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: diagnosed via blood test and symptoms, at the age of 14.  at age 27 was experiencing severe problems with mobility and pain.  After starting Nalfon 400, relief was almost immediate, and with intermittent use, (I only took it when I was hurting bad) over the next year or so, I was pain free for years.   I tried asprin,motrin,ibuprofen,tylenol,I don't remember some of the others. After taking Nalfon, I was in "remission" for years.  I didn't need anything until I hit my late 40's and early 50's.  email me at edgreason@yahoo.com.  you can come meet me and I will testify.

column2: SLang, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Had it given to me as a sample for wrist pain. It worked ok, for that , BUT it is great for alot of my other aches and pains ( low back and also shoulder).  I swear by this drug and I recommend it to everyone becacuse I have tried everything.  The nalfon agrees with me well, no stomach pain,no side effects and rapid easing of ailment.  Have not been able to get the 200mg any more so i am getting the 400mg ( hard to find either at any pharmacy, they usually have to order it).  Have not seen generic either, dont know if anyone makes it??

column1: Joint Damage causing Pain and Loss of Function
column2: rw francis, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have tried this and hydrocordone off and on for 15 years, nalfon seems to be less harder on my body, and releives my pain fairly well, as I have severe degenerative arthritus of the spine and joints, with numbness of legs, arms etc. in my body at different times

column2: Ahava212, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was given this medication by a very smart doctor.  I have the WORST menstrual cramps I have ever heard of.  For example, last night I woke up cramping, my period just starting, feeling so much in pain I was nauseous. Fenoprofen calcium is the only thing that unknots those muscles and allows me to function normally during the first few days of my period.

column2: Lenacs, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Heel spur for about a month.....went to the doctor and was prescribed Naflon 400mg.....worked like magic after 24 hours. I am now  able to walk correctly instead of hopping. Costly but worth every penny.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took this for a heel spur for two weeks, along with using a plastic heel support inside my shoe during the same time period. No improvement at all, ended up getting a steroid shot in my heel that cured the pain within 3 days. INTERESTING NOTE: The arthritis pain in my knees was pretty much eliminated during the time I took this medication, so it obviously works for some things.

column2: hrjpayne, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was in a severe car accident and have arthritis because of many surgeries. I was on Celebrex for a month and it just wasn't doing it for me. I have been taking this medicine for 3 weeks and I already see an improvement. This medicine helps me to go about my day in a more normal way.

column2: irahs, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Prescribed for Plantar fasciitis. The pain is almost gone!  Now I can walk without limping and concentrate on non-prescription treatments. My doctor told me to take it after I eat a meal because it will upset my stomach.  Was he right!  ALWAYS eat something before taking Nalfon.

column2: lovelocklady, 55-64 on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have rave reviews for this NSAID.  I am a retired RN and took this insted of ibuprofen for all my aches and pain.  It's the best of them, but I can't find a company that sells the generic

column2: Nalfon, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had an anaphyllactic reaction from this drug and nearly died!

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My legs and feet were swollen.  Nalfon took the swelling away in just one 30 day treatment.  However, I have a family history of CAD and I suffer from HBP and high cholesterol.  I don't think this drug should have been prescribed for me.

column2: Ross, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have severe swelling in my feet due to Arthritis and have been taking this for about a year (I resist having surgery now) and find it to work fairly well. I take 600 mg 3 times a day, and it help me to walk with only moderate pain.

column2: gpittman, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this med. for 8 days & the dr. gave me 8 more days for bone spurs on foot. also gave 2 shots of cortizone.I have had some reliefe but dont know if its med.or the shots. Its all i can have of both so ill see. next step surgery.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was given this medicine by my foot doctor for heel spurs.  I hasn't done anything for me at all, also made me very tired.  I find the medicine was not helpful.

column2: Dee, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have taken the medication 5 days for heel spur and have thrown up 4 times.  Medication not effective for me.
